title: Strengthening Hospitality Practical Competencies: Systematic Instructional Design for Early Childhood Computational Thinking Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Design at least three computing thinking education activities appropriate for early childhood developmental stages.
Analyze five or more tools (e.g., robots, unplugged tools) applicable to computing thinking education.

Within a six-month course, learners develop one observational tool assessing computational thinking (algorithm construction, debugging) and non-cognitive skills (collaboration, problem-solving) in young children, meeting the following criteria: 1) include at least five specific observational items, 2) pass validity verification by at least three experts, 3) ensure reliability (Cronbach’s α ≥ 0.7) after pilot testing with at least 10 children

Learners analyze at least ten prior research studies, propose three education effectiveness measurement strategies based on Kirkpatrick’s Four-Level Model (Reaction, Learning, Behavior, Results), and develop institution-tailored checklists
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
